publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2924 Ian Jenkins: Bill McLaren—That the Parliament congratulates Bill McLaren on his remarkable career in broadcasting as the unmistakable voice of rugby football, a career spanning fifty years in the course of which he has become recognised as a much admired ambassador for rugby, for Scotland and for the Borders.
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Margaret Smith*, Robin Harper*

S1M-2924 Ian Jenkins: Bill McLaren—That the Parliament congratulates Bill McLaren on his remarkable career in broadcasting as the unmistakable voice of rugby football, a career spanning fifty years in the course of which he has become recognised as a much admired ambassador for rugby, for Scotland and for the Borders. Supported by: Margaret Smith, Robin Harper
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Christine Grahame*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Donald Gorrie*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Mr Brian Monteith*, Brian Adam*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Scott Barrie*
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-2924 Bill McLaren (lodged on 20 March 2002) Alex Fergusson*
